definition: to return only a blank stare/to stare back

sentences.english: The miraculous effect of medical herbs has raised some conservative eyebrows.
sentences.chinese: 草藥的奇效簡直使一些思想保守的人瞠目結舌。

sentences.english: As long as you're not drooling or gawking, it can be sexy.
sentences.chinese: 只要你不流口水或張口瞠目，那麼就是性感的。

sentences.english: And the Tory manifesto in particular is a stunning gamble.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是託利黨的宣言，是一長令人瞠目的賭博。

sentences.english: Judged against its own past, Brazil is doing astonishingly well.
sentences.chinese: 以其自己的過去評判，巴西乾得很棒，令人瞠目結舌。

sentences.english: People stared in slack-jawed amazement at the light show.
sentences.chinese: 人們張口瞠目地注視著光影閃爍表演。

sentences.english: The 11/26 attacks lasted a mind-numbing 72 hours.
sentences.chinese: 26襲擊案持續了72小時，令人瞠目結舌。

sentences.english: Some people have become so fascinated by this practice that they have “extreme” piercings.
sentences.chinese: 有些人對其所見的“極端”穿孔藝術真是瞠目結舌。

sentences.english: Yawning valuation gaps exist among many of China's dual-listed stocks.
sentences.chinese: 許多兩地上市的中國股票都存在令人瞠目的估值差距。

sentences.english: But it was the first time I saw this phenomenon and I was completely astonished.
sentences.chinese: 但是這確實是我第一次看到讓我瞠目結舌的景象。

sentences.english: It really is an eye-popping effect.
sentences.chinese: 這真正地是一個令人瞠目喫驚的作用。

definition: glare/angry look/to open one's eyes wide/to stare angrily/to glare/to glower
tongue-tied/unable to speak (out of surprise, embarrassment etc)
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless
lit. to slap the table (in amazement, praise, anger, resentment etc)/fig. astonishing!, wonderful!, dreadful! etc
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
to remain puzzled after pondering over sth a hundred times (idiom)/to remain perplexed despite much thought
